_header: Now is England perished in fight
Subjects: evils of the time; clothing, against extremes of
_description: On the state of England — seven quatrains, generally monorime

OxfCCC237.First Lines:
Now ys yngland all in fyghtMoche peple of consyens
                    lyght…
OxfCCC237.Last Lines:
…moch bost of there clothysBut wele I wot they lake none
                    othys
OxfCCC237.Note: Added by a later hand of the fifteenth century, same as 2503.
OxfCCC237.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             Political Poems and Songs relating to English History, composed during
                the period From the Accession of Edward III to that of Richard III.
             2 vols. 
             Rolls Series
         14 (1859, 1861); repr. Kraus, 1965: 2.252-3.
Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 450.

CULHh26.First Lines:
Nowe is Englond perisshed in sightWith moche peple & consciens
                    light…
CULHh26.Last Lines:
…The cause is for lak of lightThat shuld be in the church of
                    right
CULHh26.Note: Written by a hand of the sixteenth century.
CULHh26.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Historical Poems of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         New York: Columbia UP, 1959: 149-50.
